column5: somebody wanted me to dig this stuff up, so I thought if I was going through the effort I'd post it here   everyone who has done a fly-in knows this feeling prior to departure, excited anticipation     the inflow of the Attwood (Portage) River was a steady producer all week      it's a magical spot    the big pike seemed to be in a negative mood, they did seem to turn on a little on our last day, I bet the next party in camp had a good week if the weather remained stable     I like looking for pictographs not documented before, here's some faint ones, on a secondary route near Skarrot Lk, poor picture though     a highlight of the trip was the day me and my brother towed a canoe down to the outflow, and lined it down a few rapids, the air was warm, the water was cold      we found what we were after      fat and healthy, and they fought hard      all square tails released    breakfast time for everybody      all seasons are great, but digging through this stuff makes me look forward to summer
Great memories for you Chris. A really nice report. Love those specks.
Nice report , not bad specks either
That outflow really paid off for you and your brother.
Looked like a great place!   Thanks for digging it up.   Now dig up some more!
Awesome Report! Was lakeport on sale that week
That looks heavenly right about now, thanks for postin up
Brookies and walleyes = my 2 favourite species. That looks like a dream trip to me right there!!!
I like your trip report. Nice fishing for sure In pic 1 I know what i would  anticipate ....the sh1t$  from that god awful beer. Buy some good stuff next time would ya!!!!  Hahahaha
Really nice pics and report.  That groundhog could use a bra
Those brook trout are fantastic.  When it comes to cheap swill, I'm more of a Carling guy myself haha

Really nice pics and report.  That groundhog could use a bra Lol I had to scroll back up and look at the picture again.  As everyone else is saying, great report, Looking forward to the warmer  weather and soft water
Really nice pics and report.  That groundhog could use a bra so funny
Beautiful trout pics. Sunset is awesome too. Thanks for sharing.
Great pics Chris.  Some eyes, some specks and a whole lotta beer!  Nice!!!
